Description: Fragment of ring foot and floor of pottery plate. Inside, banding and frieze of alternating triglyphs and multiple dots. Outside at base of wall and outside of foot black band, above it two narrow stripes.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Analysis of the clay did not place the piece in any known group (Schlotzhauer 2012, 187).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (Nau 163, pl. 36e-f)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.43)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4714 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
